title: Binary Tree Level Order Traversal
content:
Given the root of a binary tree, return the level order traversal of its nodes' values. (i.e., from left to right, level by level).

 

Example 1:

Input: root = [3,9,20,null,null,15,7]
Output: [[3],[9,20],[15,7]]

Example 2:

Input: root = [1]
Output: [[1]]

Example 3:

Input: root = []
Output: []

 

Constraints:

  • The number of nodes in the tree is in the range [0, 2000].
  • -1000 <= Node.val <= 1000

discussion_posts.name: Dreamoochy
discussion_posts.content: Maybe I\'m the only stupid here, but I think that more examples should be added to the description for better understanding. E.g. [1,2,3,4,5,null,7]

discussion_posts.name: int-i
discussion_posts.content: You just have to print out the order of the nodes level by level, which is a simple algorithm on the tree using a queue. Shouldn\'t this be an easy level Q since you\'re just practising the basic level order traversal mechanism ?

discussion_posts.name: gbargota
discussion_posts.content: how come the output of [1,2,3,4,null,null,5] is [[1],[2,3],[4,5]] and not [[1],[2,3],[4],[5]]?\nif you visualize[4,null] is [4] and [null,5] is [5]. so the elements [4] and [5] should be separate and not [4,5]\n

discussion_posts.name: jachang820
discussion_posts.content: Why is this medium level when it is almost exactly the same thing as [N-ary tree level order traversal](https://leetcode.com/problems/n-ary-tree-level-order-traversal/description/)?

discussion_posts.name: mohamed_waseela
discussion_posts.content:
Use a regular binary tree BFS, but the trick is to keep track of the levels, so we need to have a list of all nodes at each level.

Hint: We can do this by adding a simple loop that run as much as their is nodes in the queue,

Please Upvote if this was helpful

this is my solution:
https://leetcode.com/problems/binary-tree-level-order-traversal/solutions/2910969/java-easy-clean-solution-100-faster-code/

discussion_posts.name: daniel_9650
discussion_posts.content: Algorithm is very straightforward but the output format for C is pretty bizarre; why not just allow us to return a straight array of the values listed in level-order from left to right instead of making an array containing separate arrays for each level...? Very unnecessary inconvenience

discussion_posts.name: alex-coder
discussion_posts.content: Looks like I cannot "import Queue", and Queue is not automatically imported

discussion_posts.name: senadev42
discussion_posts.content: I honestly don\'t know if it\'s harder to do this with recursion or iteration. Should go brush up on BFS and queues, regardless.

discussion_posts.name: vyshnavkr
discussion_posts.content: - I coded my accepted solution myself and that too only after getting the whole code, base case and edge cases in mind. Its an iterative solution. Its similar to LC approach 2 - just compare.\n- LC recursive approach is worth noting // Imp: how new ArrayList is created for the first time a level is reached is worth studying!\n- LC diagrams on DFS - pre/post/in and BFS are worth picturising in mind
